channel.title: Making my first server... got an error
channel.description:
Okay first of all... this is my first post with moparscape :) and I've been spending all day trying to make a p server. I'm using "the guardian's" tutorial.
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,134771.0.html
'ultamite pk' is my source. I think i'm done up to where I click compiler and check for errors. I had to use Mod T's Ultamite Compiler, so what i get by double clicking compiler is saying basicly
"Please choose an option below to do that function. Keep posted on Moparscape tutorials section for any updates that I post.
c-Compile your server. r-Run your server. e-exit your server. jar-it will create you server into an executable Jar archive. color- Change the text and backaround colors of this compiler reset- resets you compiler logs.
Option:_ "
Still with me? lol
So when I enter "c" it says i dont have JDK 5.0 or 6.0 or any of them two updates. I think i have that downloaded. thats problem #1. How do i get it to recognize my JDK. I think its downloaded because I go to java.com and check for the best Java for my computer and it was 6.0 i think and i downloaded. plz help with that.
Problem #2 is "r" tells me I dont have a Server.class and says to make sure i've used the compiler with my server BEFORE i try running it. I have a server.class under all my files and am confused. LOOK GUYS I AM NOOB i've never done anything like this before so please dont get frusterated with me... i'm a learner. :D

item.title: Making my first server... got an error
item.dc:creator: @dorkinator dorkinator
item.description:
@dorkinator wrote:

The third pic means that you need to compile beafor you run it lol even i t3h uber noob dont know how you don’t know that…

Read full topic
item.source: Making my first server... got an error

item.title: Making my first server... got an error
item.dc:creator: @dragster32 dragster32
item.description:
@dragster32 wrote:

Well your link didnt work but the only thing i’m seeing is that i’ve been doing online instalations and you said offline soz idk if that makes a difference but i’m retrying with offline.

Edit… okay Im sure i have the right Java now does anybody have any other ideas? I’ll post pictures… a pic says a million words (as i’ve heard some of you say)

The screen I get when I click “compile.bat”. I did use Mod T’s ‘perfect compiler’ because I had to

Is this the right Java? Java™ SE Runtime Environmental 6 update 1 is what i have downloaded. When i click on my Set Program Access and Defults under the start menu thats what it says kind of Java I have.

What happens when i click run

Btw runserver.bat doesnt even bring a screen up. Neither does ServerFile.bat. A screen comes up and goes away immediatly.

any ideas now??? :([br][size=1]Posted on: May 19, 2007, 10:33:38 PM[/size][hr]

Okay i’m bumping this bad boy so somebody will actually know I need help[br][size=1]Posted on: May 20, 2007, 08:57:15 AM[/size][hr]Bump
[br][size=1]Posted on: May 20, 2007, 09:24:38 AM[/size][hr] :mad:[br][size=1]Posted on: May 20, 2007, 09:34:19 AM[/size][hr]KK i’m sure that its not registering java now. Its saying ‘javac’ is not recognized and when I use Mod T’s ‘perfect’ compiler its saying I dont have the right java. Now i know alot of ppl are reading this by the Veiw number. Will somebody who has a working server please just click on the start menu, click on Set Program Access and Defaults. Then click change or remove programs and scroll down to find your Java. Type exactly what it says there. Then atleast I know which direction to move to fix the problem :eek:
[center] Please do not double post/bump - the ‘Modify’ function exists for a reason - 3 days[/center]

Read full topic
item.source: Making my first server... got an error

item.title: Making my first server... got an error
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Lol… only reason i could think of would be that u dont have jdk… or u have set the wrong path for it

first check if you have jdk … go into ur c: drive program files java and if u have jdk 5 or 6 it shuld have jdk.1.6.0 i think or if u have jdk 5 it wuld have jdk.1.5.0 or sumthing like that im not sure if not downlaod it here https://sdlc4d.sun.com/ECom/EComActionServlet;jsessionid=7A8A8FEAB12324667D1AC429CF8259F0

and choose the offline installation if u still get any errors just ask , Hope that helps

Read full topic
item.source: Making my first server... got an error

item.title: Making my first server... got an error
item.dc:creator: @dragster32 dragster32
item.description:
@dragster32 wrote:

Somebody post a picture or something… I went to sun.com then scrolled over “downloads”. Got a bar to come down and i clicked “Java SE”. I looked under every single one of the download links, looking for a file thats 51 MB but nope none of them that i could find. The Guardian’s tutorial says download JDK 6u1. After clicking on that the only download options are 56, 57, 59, 64, 109, 10, 13, 58, 104, 7, 10, 52, 53, and 38 MG and one thats 361 KB. no 51 MBLook guys I been at this all-day so plzzz it would help soo much.[br][size=1]Posted on: May 19, 2007, 09:11:57 PM[/size][hr][quote=“tj007razor, post:2, topic:97360”]Problem #1: You may have JDK 5 or 6 but its probly in a different spot then your compiler is looking. Find JDK and replace the path with the new one.

Problem #2: fixing #1 could fix this.[/quote]
Well I have no clue where the 51MB file is so i’m just gona assume that I have that since nobody seems to be able to help me on that one. how do i change file path then like this dudes saying

Read full topic
item.source: Making my first server... got an error

item.title: Making my first server... got an error
item.dc:creator: @Zaron Zaron
item.description:
@Zaron wrote:

ROFL… u serious? o yea you are because you’re a noob, just go to www.sun.com and go to downloads and look for JDK 6 (might have like update 1 after it) then you gotta download the 51MB one and install it and your done!

Read full topic

item.title: Making my first server... got an error
item.dc:creator: @dragster32 dragster32
item.description:
@dragster32 wrote:

yes i’m happy you know what we should do but remember i’m noob how do i replace file path? I dont have a clue what that is

Read full topic

item.title: Making my first server... got an error
item.dc:creator: @dorkinator dorkinator
item.description:
@dorkinator wrote:

I have the same problem NOOBS FTW! If some one can solve this then 2 people will be happ not one.
Edit: thanks and not to hijack your topic but could you tell me the file path?

Read full topic
item.source: Making my first server... got an error

item.title: Making my first server... got an error
item.dc:creator: @tj007razor tj007razor
item.description:
@tj007razor wrote:

Problem #1: You may have JDK 5 or 6 but its probly in a different spot then your compiler is looking. Find JDK and replace the path with the new one.

Problem #2: fixing #1 could fix this.

Read full topic

‘ultamite pk’ is my source. I think i’m done up to where I click compiler and check for errors. I had to use Mod T’s Ultamite Compiler, so what i get by double clicking compiler is saying basicly
